Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • Player

  • public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    Player class - will be responsible for handling actions of that like a real world player.
    Version:
    v0.01
    Author:
    Jamie Dixon

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Player()
      Constructor for objects of class Player Sets the players hitpoints and prepares an inventory array

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addItem(java.lang.String name, Item item)
      addItem adds a new item object to the players inventory
      boolean dropItem(java.lang.String itemName)
      takeItem removes the item from the players inventory and then adds it to the players currentPosition
      Location getCurrentPosition()
      getCurrentPosition returns the players current position as a location
      java.lang.String getInventoryString()
      Return a string describing the players inventory, for example "Inventory: health".
      Item getItem(java.lang.String name)
      getItem retrieves an item from the players inventory
      boolean hasItem(java.lang.String k)
      hasItem checks if the player has an item with particular key in inventory
      boolean hasItems()
      hasItems checks if the player has ANY items in the inventory
      boolean move(java.lang.String direction)
      Move - player moves to a new location
      void removeItem(java.lang.String name)
      removeItem removes an item from the players inventory
      void setCurrentPosition(Location location)
      setCurrentPosition method Sets the players current location (brute force compared to move)
      boolean takeItem(java.lang.String itemName)
      takeItem checks if inventory is not already full and proceeds to add the item to the players inventory and remove it from the players currentPosition (location)

        Returns:

      • hasItems

        public boolean hasItems()
        hasItems checks if the player has ANY items in the inventory
        Returns:
        true if the player has >0 items otherwise false
